Demonstrating the Bug Before and After the Fix
============================================================
Testing nested compound model: Pix2Sky_TAN() & (Linear1D(10) & Linear1D(5))

BEFORE FIX (buggy behavior):
separability_matrix(nested_model) =
[[ True  True False False]
 [ True  True False False]
 [False False  True  True]
 [False False  True  True]]

AFTER FIX (correct behavior):
separability_matrix(nested_model) =
[[ True  True False False]
 [ True  True False False]
 [False False  True False]
 [False False False  True]]

EXPECTED:
[[ True  True False False]
 [ True  True False False]
 [False False  True False]
 [False False False  True]]

ANALYSIS:
✓ Buggy version produces incorrect result (as expected)
  The bug caused the last two rows to be [True, True] instead of diagonal
✓ Fixed version produces correct result

THE BUG:
In the original code, when handling nested compound models, the _cstack
function would set `cright[-right.shape[0]:, -right.shape[1]:] = 1`
instead of `cright[-right.shape[0]:, -right.shape[1]:] = right`
This caused the separability information from nested models to be lost.

THE FIX:
Changed line 245 in separable.py from:
  cright[-right.shape[0]:, -right.shape[1]:] = 1
to:
  cright[-right.shape[0]:, -right.shape[1]:] = right

This preserves the separability matrix from nested compound models.

============================================================
